title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or translations and to score the response.

One point is awarded for each correctly translated segment. Student must correctly translate all words in a given segment to receive credit for that segment.

Note: The passage is segmented in such a way as to achieve a balance of easy, medium, and hard segments. Glosses are added to the passage only in order to make a given segment easier, so uncommon words in harder segments will not necessarily be glossed.

Note: The model translation provided below is merely a suggestion of how the passage might accurately be translated. Teachers should use their discretion in accepting alternative translations of any given segment.
descriptions:
The response does not accurately include any of the translations below.

· Segment 1: hac oratione adducti [this; by/with/from/because of (this) oration, speech, pleading, message, statement, utterance, discourse, address, oratory, argument; by/from/because of these words; persuaded, prompted, motivated, led, brought (along/etc.), attracted, drawn, induced, influenced, convinced, moved]

· Segment 2: inter se [ between/among/to/with; themselves, one another, each other]

· Segment 3: fidem et ius iurandum [trust, loyalty, guarantee, promise, assurance, evidence, confirmation, proof, certainty, fidelity, credit, (good) faith, pledge, allegiance, protection, confidence, credibility, trustworthiness, reliability, belief, conviction, credence [must be rendered as direct object of dant]; and; oath [must be rendered as direct object of dant]]

· Segment 4: dant (et) [they give, confer, make, bestow, present, offer, produce, swear [or equivalent past tense]; and]

· Segment 5: (et) regno occupato [and; (with) the kingship, (ruling) power, monarchy, throne, rule, (royal) sway, tyranny, (political) control, dominion, kingdom, realm, domain; (having been) claimed, seized, grasped, appropriated, taken, gotten, possessed, occupied, assumed, made their own [Ablatives absolute may be rendered as subordinate clauses; however, the tense, voice, and number of the participle must be rendered accurately.]]

· Segment 6: per tres [through, by (means/reason of); three (of)]

· Segment 7: potentissimos ac firmissimos populos [most/very/extremely/etc. powerful, potent, capable, influential, mighty, strong, efficacious, effective [must be superlative]; and; most/very/extremely/etc. strong, stout, durable, robust, sturdy, firm, sound, fit, secure, substantial, solid, powerful, stable, resolute, determined, steadfast, confident, bold, fearless, staunch, reliable, unfaltering [must be superlative]; people, populations, communities, nations, societies, populaces, tribes, groups (of people) [must be construed with per]]

· Segment 8: totius Galliae [(of) the whole of, all, the entirety of; Gaul]

· Segment 9: sese potiri posse sperant [(that) they, themselves; to take possession of, gain control of, make (themselves)/become master of, obtain (control of), capture, get hold of, attain, acquire, possess, control; (they) are/will be /would be able, can/could; to be able; they hope, expect, look forward to, anticipate [or equivalent past tense]]

· Segment 10: res [thing, matter, affair, situation, fact, deed, activity, business, circumstance]

· Segment 11: ea est enuntiata Helvetiis [this, the; is/was announced, declared, related, made known, disclosed, divulged, expressed, stated, asserted, proclaimed, articulated; to the Helvetians]

· Segment 12: per indicium [through, by; disclosure, information, intelligence, evidence, indication]

· Segment 13: moribus suis [by/from/(in accordance) with/in/because of (established) practice(s), custom(s), usage(s), tradition(s), habit(s), moral(s), ethic(s), mores, manner(s), way(s), fashion(s); their (own), of them(selves)]

· Segment 14: ex vinculis [from, out of, with, in; bonds, chains, fetters, shackles, fastenings, restraints]

· Segment 15: Orgetorigem causam dicere coegerunt [Orgetorix; case, cause, judicial proceeding, trial, claim, reason, excuse, pretext, ground, justification, motive, purpose; speak, state, plead, talk, tell, say, declare, assert; compelled, bound, drove, forced, constrained, summoned [or true perfect]]
The response accurately includes one of the translations below.
The response accurately includes two of the translations below.
The response accurately includes three of the translations below.
The response accurately includes four of the translations below.
The response accurately includes five of the translations below.
The response accurately includes six of the translations below.
The response accurately includes seven of the translations below.
The response accurately includes eight of the translations below.
The response accurately includes nine of the translations below.
The response accurately includes 10 of the translations below.
The response accurately includes 11 of the translations below.
The response accurately includes 12 of the translations below.
The response accurately includes 13 of the translations below.
The response accurately includes 14 of the translations below.
The response accurately includes all 15 of the translations below.
